verses.verse: Rehoboam<WH7346> went<WH3212> to Shechem;<WH7927> for all Israel<WH3478> had come<WH935> to Shechem<WH7927> to make him king.<WH4427>

King<WH4428> Rehoboam<WH7346> took counsel<WH3289> with the old<WH2205> men,<WH5975> who had stood before<WH6440> Solomon<WH8010> his father<WH1> while he yet lived,<WH2416> saying,<WH559> "What<WH349> counsel do you give<WH3289> me to return<WH7725> answer<WH1697> to this people?<WH5971>"

He said<WH559> to them,<WH3289> "What counsel do you give,<WH7725> that we may return answer<WH1697> to this people,<WH5971> who have spoken<WH1696> to me,<WH559> saying, <WH5923> 'Make the yoke that your father<WH1> put<WH5414> on us lighter?<WH7043>'"

The young men<WH3206> who had grown up<WH1431> with him spoke<WH1696> to him,<WH559> saying, "Thus you shall tell<WH559> the people<WH5971> who spoke<WH1696> to you,<WH559> saying, <WH1> 'Your father made<WH3513> our yoke<WH5923> heavy,<WH3513> but make it lighter<WH7043> on us;<WH559>' thus you shall say to them,<WH6995> 'My little finger is thicker<WH5666> than my father<WH1>'s waist.<WH4975>

Now whereas<WH6258> my father<WH1> burdened<WH6006> you with a heavy<WH3515> yoke,<WH5923> I will add<WH3254> to your yoke.<WH5923> My father<WH1> chastised<WH3256> you with whips,<WH7752> but I will chastise you with scorpions.<WH6137>'"

The king<WH4428> answered<WH6030> them roughly;<WH7186> and king<WH4428> Rehoboam<WH7346> forsook<WH5800> the counsel<WH6098> of the old men,<WH2205>

and spoke<WH1696> to them after the counsel<WH6098> of the young men,<WH3206> saying,<WH559> "My father<WH1> made your yoke<WH5923> heavy,<WH3513> but I will add<WH3254> to it.<WH1> My father chastised<WH3256> you with whips,<WH7752> but I will chastise you with scorpions.<WH6137>"

So the king<WH4428> didn't<WH8085> listen to the people;<WH5971> for it was brought<WH5252> about of God,<WH430> that Yahweh<WH3068> might establish<WH6965> his word,<WH1697> which he spoke<WH1696> by<WH3027> Ahijah<WH281> the Shilonite<WH7888> to Jeroboam<WH3379> the son<WH1121> of Nebat.<WH5028>

When all Israel<WH3478> saw<WH7200> that the king<WH4428> didn't<WH8085> listen to them,<WH5971> the people answered<WH7725> the king,<WH4428> saying,<WH559> "What portion<WH2506> have we in David?<WH1732> Neither have we inheritance<WH5159> in the son<WH1121> of Jesse!<WH3448> Every man<WH376> to your tents,<WH168> Israel!<WH3478> Now see<WH7200> to your own house,<WH1004> David.<WH1732>" So all Israel<WH3478> departed<WH3212> to their tents.<WH168>
But as for the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> who lived<WH3427> in the cities<WH5892> of Judah,<WH3063> Rehoboam<WH7346> reigned over them.<WH4427>

Then king<WH4428> Rehoboam<WH7346> sent<WH7971> Hadoram,<WH1913> who was over the men subject to forced labor;<WH4522> and the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> stoned<WH7275> him to death<WH4191> with stones.<WH68> King<WH4428> Rehoboam<WH7346> made speed<WH553> to get himself up<WH5927> to his chariot,<WH4818> to flee<WH5127> to Jerusalem.<WH3389>
So Israel<WH3478> rebelled<WH6586> against the house<WH1004> of David<WH1732> to this day.<WH3117>
